critique: This document pertains to the implementation of US tax law in Guam following the Organic Act of Guam. It is an executive order that puts into effect section 31 of the Organic Act, which states that US income tax laws are in force in Guam. The order is authorized by section 34 of the same act, which allows the President to transition the administration of Guam. There's no indication of ideological bias, immigration policy, or civil liberties concerns. The order implements existing law, so it doesn't expand executive power significantly. It does exert federal control over Guam's tax system, indicating a federalism score. There is no impact on social inclusion. There is no economic regulation.
